intro: Artemisia tilhoana, commonly known as the Tilhoan wormwood, is a perennial shrub native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant is distinguished by its silver-gray, finely divided leaves that emit a strong, camphor-like scent when crushed. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or arid soils. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in herbal remedies for its anti-inflammatory and antiseptic qualities.
